Lib¶

app_globals¶

The application’s Globals object

class spam.lib.app_globals.Globals¶

Container for objects available throughout the life of the application.

One instance of Globals is created during application initialization and is available during requests via the ‘app_globals’ variable.

base¶

The base Controller API.

class spam.lib.base.BaseController(*args, **kwargs)¶

Base class for the controllers in the application.

Your web application should have one of these. The root of your application is used to compute URLs used by your app.

class spam.lib.base.SPAMBaseController(*args, **kwargs)¶

Base class for the controllers in SPAM.

This base controller initialize and expose some items to templates.

decorators¶

Custom decorators for SPAM.

spam.lib.decorators.asset_set_active(func)¶

Extract the current asset id from the args passed to the function and puts the corresponding asset in the template context.

If the asset id is not valid raise an error.

spam.lib.decorators.project_set_active(func)¶

Extract the current project id from the args passed to the function and puts the corresponding project in the template context.

If the project id is not valid raise an error.

exceptions¶

Custom errors for SPAM.

SPAM errors are derived from HTTPClientError and are given a 400 HTTP error code, so the WSGI error middleware can take care of them.

exception spam.lib.exceptions.SPAMDBError¶

Database Error.

exception spam.lib.exceptions.SPAMDBNotFound¶

DB Element Not Found.

exception spam.lib.exceptions.SPAMError¶

SPAM Error.

exception spam.lib.exceptions.SPAMRepoError¶

Repository Error.

exception spam.lib.exceptions.SPAMRepoNotFound¶

Repository Not Found.

helpers¶

WebHelpers used in spam.

journaling¶

Journaling system.

class spam.lib.journaling.Journaler¶

Helper to write a journal entry in the database and send a stomp notification.

This helper saves a couple of lines of code for each journal write.

jsonify¶

JSON encoding functions using EAK-Rules.

Stolen from tg2.1 and modified to use standard lib json instead of simplejson if available.

class spam.lib.jsonify.GenericJSON(skipkeys=False, ensure_ascii=True, check_circular=True, allow_nan=True, sort_keys=False, indent=None, separators=None, encoding='utf-8', default=None)¶

A JSON encoder that manages SQLAlchemy objects.

spam.lib.jsonify.encode(obj)¶

Return a JSON string representation of a Python object.

spam.lib.jsonify.encode_iter(obj)¶

Encode object, yielding each string representation as available.

notifications¶

STOMP notifications.

predicates¶

Custom predicates for SPAM.

class spam.lib.predicates.is_asset_artist(msg=None)¶

Predicate for checking whether the visitor is an artist for the given asset.

This predicate requires “project_set_active” and “asset_set_active” decorators earlier in the stack, because it relies on tmpl_context.project and tmpl_context.asset to be set.

class spam.lib.predicates.is_asset_owner(msg=None)¶

Predicate for checking whether the visitor is the owner of the given asset.

This predicate requires “project_set_active” and “asset_set_active” decorators earlier in the stack, because it relies on tmpl_context.project and tmpl_context.asset to be set.

class spam.lib.predicates.is_asset_supervisor(msg=None)¶

Predicate for checking whether the visitor is a supervisor for the given asset.

This predicate requires “project_set_active” and “asset_set_active” decorators earlier in the stack, because it relies on tmpl_context.project and tmpl_context.asset to be set.

class spam.lib.predicates.is_project_admin(msg=None)¶

Predicate for checking whether the visitor is an administrator of the current project.

This predicate requires the “project_set_active” decorator earlier in the stack, because it relies on tmpl_context.project to be set.

class spam.lib.predicates.is_project_user(msg=None)¶

Predicate for checking whether the visitor is a valid project user.

This predicate requires the “project_set_active” decorator earlier in the stack, because it relies on tmpl_context.project to be set.

preview¶

Preview and thumbnailing module.

repo¶

Mercurial repository management.

spam.lib.repo.cat(proj, assetver)¶

Helper to retrive the file(s) corresponding to a specific asset version from the repository.

Call :meth:cat_multi or :meth:cat_single based on the asset type.

spam.lib.repo.cat_multi(proj, assetver)¶

Return the files corresponding to the given asset version in a zip archive (ready for http download), retriving them from the mercurial repository.

spam.lib.repo.cat_single(proj, assetver)¶

Return the file corresponding to the given asset version, retriving it from the mercurial repository.

spam.lib.repo.commit(proj, asset, filenames, text, username=None)¶

Helper to commit a new version of an asset to the repository.

Call :meth:commit_multi or :meth:commit_single based on the asset type.

spam.lib.repo.commit_multi(proj, asset, filenames, text, username=None)¶

Commit multiple files to the repository and returns the revision id.

spam.lib.repo.commit_single(proj, asset, filename, text, username=None)¶

Commit a single file to the repository and returns the revision id.

spam.lib.repo.libgroup_create_dirs(proj, libgroup)¶

Create directories in the repository for libgroup.

spam.lib.repo.project_create_dirs(proj)¶

Create default directories in the repository for proj.

spam.lib.repo.repo_get(proj)¶

Return the mercurial repository for proj.

spam.lib.repo.repo_init(proj)¶

Init a new mercurial repository for proj.

spam.lib.repo.scene_create_dirs(proj, scene)¶

Create directories in the repository for scene.

spam.lib.repo.shot_create_dirs(proj, shot)¶

Create directories in the repository for shot.

validators¶

Custom form validators for SPAM.

class spam.lib.validators.CategoryNamingConvention(category_field, **kw)¶

Confirm an asset name matches the naming convention for its category.

category_field
Name of the sibling field this must match

class spam.lib.widgets.Upload(**kw)¶

Advanced upload field for the publish asset form.

An Upload field uploads file to the server as they are selected (or dragged onto it) and shows a progress bar for the upload.
